title: Wages increase more than worker productivity

content.question: Which of the following would be the initial impact on an economy if wages were to increase more than worker productivity?

choices.label: There would be no initial impact, since neither the aggregate supply curve nor the aggregate demand curve would shift.
Employment would increase, causing a rightward shift in the aggregate demand curve.
The price level would increase, resulting in excess aggregate supply.
The short-run aggregate supply curve would shift to the left, increasing the price level.
The aggregate demand curve would shift to the left, increasing the price level.

content.answer: The short-run aggregate supply curve would shift to the left, increasing the price level.

topic.text: 3.6: Changes in the AD-AS Model in the Short Run

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
